com.mcc.ul
Class TmrDevice

java.lang.Object
  com.mcc.ul.TmrDevice

public class TmrDevice
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a timer subsystem on a DAQ device. In addition to timer methods, this class contains methods to access information and the configuration of the timer subsystem.

To create an instance of this class, call the getTmrDev() method of the DaqDevice class.

Method Summary

          Returns TmrInfo.
 TmrOutStatus getTmrOutStatus(int timerNum)

          Starts a timer square wave output.

getInfo

public TmrInfo getInfo()
Returns TmrInfo.

Returns:
The TmrInfo object.

tmrOutStart

public TmrOutSettings tmrOutStart(int channel,
                                  TmrOutSettings timerSettings)
                           throws ULException
Starts a timer to generate digital pulses at a specified frequency and duty cycle.

Call tmrOutStop to stop the output. Use this method with devices that have a timer-type counter.

Parameters:
channel - Timer channel number.
timerSettings - TmrOutSettings
Returns:
The TmrOutSettings object.
Throws:
ULException

tmrOutStart

public double tmrOutStart(int channel,
                          double frequency)
                   throws ULException
Starts a timer square wave output.

Call tmrOutStop to stop the output. Use this method with devices that have a timer-type counter.

Parameters:
channel - The channel number where you want to output the square wave.
frequency - The square wave frequency in Hz. The timers clock is divided down by integer values to produce the frequency. Valid values are dependent on the timers clock and resolution.
Returns:
The actual frequency output.
Throws:
ULException

tmrOutStop

public void tmrOutStop(int channel)
                throws ULException
Stops the output of a specified timer channel.

Parameters:
channel - Timer channel number.
Throws:
ULException

Returns the TmrOutStatus enumeration indicating the status of the output operation referenced by the current instance of TmrDevice.
